Biology

Campsicnemus femoratus is common and occasionally abundant along forest streams in the central boreal zone of Finland. Its rarity in museum collections is explained by the combination of a northern distribution, an early/late occurrence of the adults and a species-poor habitat often skipped by collectors of Dolichopodidae : the adults are on the wing in May and September when these forests may still have a partial snow cover.
Distribution
New to Finland. Previously known from Sweden and Russian East Siberia ( Negrobov 1991 , Ringdahl 1949 ).
